headline: Fast and Friendly Meatballs
description: These easy turkey meatballs are simple to prepare with just four ingredients, and they bake up in just 20 minutes for a quick, kid-friendly meal.

video.description: Make these oven-baked meatballs with turkey or ground beef.
video.name: Fast and Friendly Meatballs

name: Fast and Friendly Meatballs

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish with oil, and place it into the oven while preheating.
Mix turkey, bread crumbs, and egg together in a bowl with your hands. Use an ice cream scoop to form mixture into golf ball-sized meatballs.
Remove the baking dish from the oven. Place meatballs into the hot dish, about 1 inch apart. Press gently on each meatball to flatten the bottom just slightly.

Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Flip meatballs over and continue baking until somewhat crispy on the outside, about 5 more minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: Super yummy. Made mods. Sorry. Sub ground beef and sausage. Add garlic.
So delicious! Better yet, my kids love them! I added Panko breadcrumbs with the Italian breadcrumbs. Dash of garlic salt.
Excellent
Followed the recipe exactly except I made them smaller for little bite sized meatballs. Turned out great!
Simple and easy to make, but because of that the meatballs and bland and tasteless.
Very good. I am not the best chef, but they were very tasty and I will definitely make again.

This was a great easy recipe but a bit bland even for my grandkids when I made it the first time exactly as written. Following a reviewerâ€™s advice and my own addition this was a 5 star recipe the second time and gobbled up. I only had 1 lb. of 93% lean turkey breast. I reduced the bread crumbs to 1/4 cup but kept the whole egg and added 1/8 cup water. I also added 2 Tbsp. of parmesan cheeseI. I used 1/4 tsp. ground sage and 1 tsp. each of onion powder, garlic powder, salt and 3/4 tsp. pepper. I also added a teaspoon of fresh thyme overflowing from my aero- garden. I served it with jarred marinara sauce with extra fresh basil , spaghetti noodles and grated parmesan on top. Delicious and still easy!
Great basic recipe! I make my own spice blends and dry rubs, and adding 2-3 tbsp of any of them to this recipe gives perfect results every time! Thanks!
Easy to make and eat.
Granddaughters both ate them! I followed the recipe. After baking I let them simmer in the sauce for about 30 minutes. Definitely keeping this recipe.
They had good flavor but needed salt. Ill make them again but add a little salt
First time I have ever made meatballs. Added them to zoodles with pasta sauce - turned out great.
I will .
This dish was a success, thank you! Very easy to make. I actually used ground chicken instead of ground turkey. Great recipe??

The meatballs came out amazing even though I didnt follow the recipe to a T. I didnt have Italian seasoning so I just added a few sprinkles of Adobo and dried parsley flakes. Substituted all panko instead of Italian bread crumbs. Came out super crunchy on the exterior but moist on the inside.

I used coconut oil on foil paper, added chopped onion and substitute crumbled ritz crackers for bread crumbs. DELICIOUS! I served over cous cous with steamed red pepper, carrot and broccoli. Drizzled with Teriaky sauce. Vwala!

I actually forgot to preheat the olive oil greased pan, so I cooked for 20 mins and then turned and cooked for 8 mins more. Put finished meatballs in shallow pot with leftover spaghetti sauce and left on simmer for about an hour. Very good.*****Made again with 2-3 tablespoons of grated parmesan, onion powder, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Added a splash or two of whole milk to the egg then beat. Folded the dry ingredients into the egg/milk mixture then folded THAT mixture into the ground meat.

SO easy for busy moms. I used slightly dampened 100% whole grain bread in place of bread crumbs, added minced garlic (to our tastes) and fresh, chopped parsley (to our tastes). 

In the tradition of my mother, I put 1 tsp of olive oil into a pot in which I sauteed the fresh garlic, then added the meatballs and cooked until nicely browned. I then poured the sauce into the pot, covered it, and simmered it for 30 mins. This adds lots of flavor to the sauce. I also like to add the cooked pasta to the sauce and meatballs. My family loves meatballs and pasta this way. Much faster cleanup...only one pot.

Next time, I plan to make extras for portioned freezing. MORE than YUMMLY!!
Fantastic and easy recipe!

Yum! Good basic meatball recipe. I added onions, garlic powder, onion powder, salt & pepper, and a hint of basil + oregano . I bought basil & tomato sauce and used birds eye's spaghetti veggies.I'm gonna continue playing around with the seasonings , but this dish was delicious and super fast to make (+ clean up was easy!)
I don't understand how this recipe has such a high rating, with no seasonings or anything its flavorless.
I always bought store bought meatballs. Never again! So very easy and so very delicious!!

This is a really good recipe for meatballs. They were a hit. I followed the recipe except I used hamburger meat instead of turkey though, and did add some garlic salt. I used them to make spaghetti and meatballs. I will be making these again.
Cooked as directed by recipe, they were meh. We added salt at the dinner table. Iâ€™m sure theyâ€™re better with added ingredients.
I was surprised at how good these were! I added some salt, pepper, and grated parmesan. This was my first time making turkey meatballs and I think they'll become a staple around here :)

This recipe is very fast and easy to make. I'm quite new to cooking so it wasn't quite as intimidating as some of the other recipes I found. I didn't have olive oil and I used plain breadcrumbs, so it wasn't quite as flavorful as it could have been, but I'm happy with how they turned out otherwise.

I am so tired of reviewers using the term "bland" so I won't use that term, but these meatballs are about as "tasteless" and "boring" as any I have ever eaten. There isn't enough seasoning in 1/3 cup seasoned bread crumbs to enhance the flavor. Needs salt, pepper, onion powder, garlic powder, parsley... some of the above or all of the above. Too many "Great" meatball recipes out there that are worthy of your time and money!

This is a basic, easy, meatball recipe that derives it's seasoning from the Italian style bread crumbs. It was good but I felt it needed more seasoning. The review is supposed to be about this recipe. Not the one that folks have added 12 additional ingredients and then gave it a five. 
Yep, Italian meatballs must have Pecorino Romano cheese; fresh garlic, fresh onion, parsley (ingredients you will find in the Italian breadcrumbs, but not enough to make this Italian a happy camper.
So if you want a basic recipe that you can enhance to your taste, this is great. 

People, stop saying the recipe is good, but I added half the pantry...... If you had to add half the pantry, then the recipe wasn't good!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It's now no longer the recipe posted, it's your own recipe you are rating .

People look for recipes and rely on ratings to even stop to read the recipe....when the recipe is not reviewed on its own merit, the rating system means nothing.

These meatballs turned out very good. And so easy! I added various Italian seasonings and fresh garlic. The consistency of the meatballs was excellent. Not too mushy or dense which I have had problems with before. It's become my go to meatball recipe. Thanks for sharing.
Incredibly simple recipe, and my kids love it!
Super easy to make and very tasty. I baked the meatballs on parchment paper for easy cleanup (and no need for Olive oil) and then mixed them with BBQ sauce. It was a huge hit.

Easy peasy! Added some Italian seasoning, garlic powder and a bit of garlic salt without measuring, just eyeballed it. (very unlike me). Added a jar of pasta sauce and some spaghetti noodles and viola! quick, good and easy!

These turkey meatballs are the bes I ever had. I made a few changes in this recipe. I used Italian seasoned ground turkey. replaced the egg with eggbeaters. I used cracker crumbs instead of the bread crumbs. Also used an ice cream scoop. Instead of baking these. Instead I browned them and finished cooking them in the sauce.

I gave it 5 stars because I followed Sandra's additional ingredients. We all loved them, great flavor, nice firm texture. I did leave mine in the oven longer to get a little more brown. My wife is a big beef eater and she even liked them . Definitely a keeper were her words.
I cook mine in a skillet on the stovetop. These are very good and very easy.
I loved it. I used hamburger instead. Also added green peppers and onions.
I added another seven minutes of cooking because they did not look done enough. Otherwise they tasted good. Be aware of the timing if planning a meal.
Freeze well.
Easy and tasty!

this was a great recipe. I was initially concerned that 350Â° wasn't high enough, but I was wrong and they turned out a lot more moist and kept their shape better at the lower temp. I also added Italian seasoning because I only had regular breadcrumbs, garlic and Parmesan cheese.
Very simple and quick to make. Per some other reviews, I added some grated parmesan, garlic powder and onion powder.

First of all, PLEASE don't rate recipes and then advise on all of the additional ingredients/processes you added! I followed this recipe exactly and it was a very good, basic meatball. Nice proportions and they are very kid friendly!
It was pretty good, I liked the fast cook time but the recipe seemed a little plain. Other than that pretty decent.

seriously, this is my go to recipe for when I want an easy dinner. I use a baking stone so I don't use the oil when preheating but that's the only change I made. the recipe itself is just right. so much easier than making them on the stove top.
Great recipe and even better with two tablespoons of chopped garlic!
Meat balls were delicious. Very moist. I added some McCormick's garlic & herb salt.
I added about 1/4 cup parmesan cheese and 1/2 tsp garlic powder to the recipe, and the meatballs turned out great. Quick, easy, tasty, healthy recipe!
This is a great basic recipe. I add more Italian seasonings and garlic, even cut up veggies sometimes but, as written is the perfect base. It's also the perfect kid pleaser!
I used beef. They were a good texture, but if I make them again I would definitely add at least a little salt and pepper. They were rather bland.
Good base recipe that makes a moist meatball.
Loved it! So easy!!
Needs spices or sauce or something! That said, the toddler and teens liked it, so maybe some kind of sauce would do it.
Best meatballs i've ever made. Sometimes simple is best, especially with a three year old.
I have made this recipe about 6 times now, my family absolutely loves it! The only thing I changed up is instead of using the olive oil on the pan I mix it in with the meatballs. So delicious!

So yummy! But used ground beef instead of ground turkey. Also added some Parmesan to the mixture and loved it. Will definitely be using this recipe again! This recipe is also a good starter to add more flavors for the adventure seekers.

Start with this recipe, and customize for your taste. I made my own breadcrumbs using leftover bread, Italian seasoning, and salt and pepper. I followed the rest of the recipe, but after removing from the oven, I added it to my homemade marinara sauce. Delicious. Thanks for the great recipe.
These are easy to make and delicious!
Made it just like the recipe. Everyone loved it. It's become a weekday regular for us.
Absolutely love this recipe and I did change it up a bit I added onion chives, mushrooms and mozzarella. And it came out delish.

This was soooo easy!!!! And DELICIOUS! I added 2tbs of parm cheese as well as some garlic and onion powder. After they were in the oven I let them simmer in my marinara sauce and they were perfect. Great flavor and super soft. Definitely making again
Did not make any changes. Did cook then in a pressure cooker. Took less time. Then added noodles with my own sauce. My hamburger was 80/20. Along with the sausage it was moist.
I added the onion powder, garlic powder and sage as the review I read did. I only used 1/2 teaspoon of each. I added some shredded mozzarella, salt and pepper. Turned out great. Will make again.
Super easy.
I used ground beef and added some garlic, onion and pepper and it was easy and good.
Definitely a keeper, super easy too. I used the very lean turkey meat and added a little olive oil, Parmesan cheese, onions, and a little extra garlic to the mix. Delicious and very moist!

I made this w/ the addition of spices SandraM listed. I also fried them to get it crispy. Served over buttered egg noodles and everyone gobbled them up. NEXT Time: I baked them for 15 minutes, then the last 5 I broiled them to brown the tops. This is super quick to put together.
nice and simple

These meatballs are fine, but as written, I can only give the recipe three stars. I like to trust the recipe when preparing it the first time, since I am no expert. So I didn't add anything, even salt and pepper, even though my instincts told me I should. Without salt and pepper, or as other reviewers have suggested, combinations of the following: sage, Parmesan cheese, onion powder, garlic powder, etc. Since none of those things are written into the recipe, I assumed those flavors would come from the bread crumbs, but not so. Next time, I'll add some of those spices and a good recipe will be even better.
Easy and turned out great

It's a good, easy basic recipe, as the title denotes. You could probably do more with spices, onion, garlic, whatnot, but my gravy tends to have a bite to it, so I like to just keep the meatballs basic and let the gravy shine.

This was so easy!!! My ten year old daughter and her friend loved the meatballs. I used 94% lean ground beef instead of ground turkey. I made the meatballs and then served them with spaghetti and Emerils marinara sauce!! ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS AND SOOO EASY!!!

This was delicious and a great hit with friends and family everyone was asking for the recipe. I used beef instead of turkey and added Italian seasoning, garlic, onion, and parmigiano cheese. Will definitely do it again
These were great, would definitely make them again!
These are so easy and so yummy. I just added some spices. Salt, pepper, garlic salt, garlic powder, onion powder, and dried parsley. We all loved them!

This recipe was a hit with my family! We aren't big on turkey so I used the same amount of pork as a substitute. I also did one cup of breadcrumbs and added a generous half cup of grated parmesean cheese. Will definitely be making this again!
Very easy and tasty. I added a bit of the oil to the meatballs and I added some onion powder. Otherwise I made as directed.
Super easy and pretty tasty. Made as directed except plain breadcrumbs with 1 tsp dry Italian seasoning. Next time would add extra garlic. Consider cooking at higher temp for crispier outside.
Kids & adults love! I bake them at 350 for 15 min, turn & cook for 5 more. Then I cook in sauce.

I was looking for a basic recipe that I could add my own flavors to so this worked out great. I used ground beef and added 2 tbsp of Italian seasoning, added some onion, garlic, salt, pepper, and parsley and 2 tbsp water (or milk). I think you could do a lot of different flavor combos with this recipe so I will be experimenting in the future. Great simple recipe. I cooked them according to the directions but I added 5 extra minutes at the end to brown them a bit more.

Easy to make your own! I added about 2 Tbsp of parmesan, 1 tsp Italian seasoning, salt and pepper to taste. I also used beef instead of turkey. It took an extra 15 minutes to bake at a lower temperature, but they were amazing! Everybody loved them!
Made with ground beef instead of turkey.
Add pinch of onion and garlic powder Also small amount of balsamic syrup to cut the acidity

I love to make these on Sunday to have around during the week. Great for lunches and dinner add-ons. 

I added 1/4 cup of parmesan cheese and grilled some onions and garlic and through into the mixture once it cooled. I didn't find it needed any additional seasoning when using the Italian breadcrumbs, except for salt and pepper to taste. 

I generally do not turn them in the oven, and I toss them into a crockpot with either my favorite spaghetti sauce (Paul Newman's Sockarooni) or a brown gravy. They taste better as the week goes on :-)

I used ground beef (because it's what I had) and I added some Italian seasoning ..made them in my Nu-wave oven..just baked them till they were crispy. Served on top of spaghetti and marinara sauce with French bread. Delicious!

These were delicious even my teenagers loved them!! I did however change adding bread crumbs since I didn't have any. I did a package of Lipton Onion Soup Mix and poured some Italian dressing over the meat mixture and it turned out excellent!!! Will be making this recipe often.
I made it as is and it was pretty bland. I would follow the the suggestions of some of the reviewers and add some sausage and other spices.

This a good beginner's recipe. The meatball mix is pretty plain so I added fresh parsley, garlic powder, herbs (oregano, dried basil). I always test the first meatball for seasoning by pan frying it. It was excellent after all the adjustments. I baked the rest of my meatballs as per the recipe directions and I have to say that baking it completely ruined the meatballs. Meatballs are usually pan fried first, which brings out the flavours and keeps the juices in. For me, since these were already turkey and lean, it was not worth saving few calories by baking them instead of pan frying first. Huge difference in flavor.

Great recipe! Followed others suggestions by adding garlic powder, onion powder, italian seasoning and parm cheese.
Made these with roasted spaghetti squash (keeping a low carb lifestyle) and Nanny's spaghetti sauce from this site. Whole dinner was only 400 calories and I am full!
Easy and fast great recipe for meatballs if you have never made them before!

I made them with ground beef, I used garlic cheese croutons instead of bread crumbs because bread doesn't last long enough to get stale around here plus I thought they'd add great extra flavor. I also seasoned with salt, pepper, onion powder, garlic powder, chili powder, and paprika. I've never made meatballs before, and these turned out great! !!!
Rediculously easy! I will definitely make again :)
Great way to cook them, however the meat definitely needs some spices mixed in for added flavor
I will make this again.my hubby and I gobbled these up! Added pepper,oregeno,worsteshire sauce and used regular bread crumbs. Meatballs were excellent!

These were great as written, and I followed the baking and mixing directions exactly. I only added a little seasoning for flavor, and used crushed Ritz instead of bread crumbs because of what I had on hand. Ended up glazing them in Sweet Baby Ray's sweet and spicy BBQ sauce the last 10 minutes to make them BBQ meatballs. They were SO tender, so moist, so delicious. Props for being my first rated recipe on AR!! LOVE EM!

Thank you for this simple,straight forward meatball recipe!! I just made these and added some Italian spices,garlic powder,dry basil leaves,salt & pepper to taste and about 1/4 cup fresh grated Parmesan cheese. Excellent
Yes easy, but just ok. Not a lot of flavor.
I added oregano, sea salt, and extra virgin olive oil to mix.

Super easy! I used 94% lean ground turkey and added a tbps of olive oil. Also added the following seasonings to whole wheat breadcrumbs: basil, oregano, garlic and onion powder, salt and pepper. Added 2 tbsp of parm cheese. Baked as directed and then simmered in marinara. Very good.

I ended up using Italian seasoned turkey (because it was on sale) but these were still delightfully easy to make. I baked mine a little longer to make them a nice brown color and they turned out yummy. I made a big batch so I can just heat them up whenever I make pasta or want a snack.
